name: ballistic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
connected with ballistics (= the study of the behaviour of objects that are shot or thrown through the air, such as a bullet from a gun): None of the defendants could be linked to the fatal gunshot because of a lack of ballistic evidence. They established a ballistic "fingerprinting" database to help law enforcement officials track guns throughout the state. Related words
ballistics
ballistically
(of a weapon, etc.) moving and falling to earth or onto its target using the force of gravity only: The country is thought to have ballistic, chemical, and biological weapons capabilities. The space capsule malfunctioned and fell back to Earth in a steep ballistic path that subjected those inside to high G-forces. See also
ballistic missile go ballistic
informal to become extremely angry: If your dad finds out you've been skipping school, he'll go ballistic.
